page.title: 05Economic/political history.
page.content: Formerly a coal mining area with many small levels. These were replaced by deep shaft mines but many now closed, Oakdale Colliery remains. Light, mixed industries tend to be concentrated on industrial estates as at Pontllanfraith. Earlier industrial housing was terraced but with growth of housing estates, the estate agents and building society offices have grown in number. The area has tended to be socialist due to its industrial nature. The chartist movement of 1839 developed here as did the Labour movement of the early 20th century. Neil Kinnock, the leader of the Labour party, is the member of parliament for the Bedwellty constituency which includes this area.
